 Nope - two cases in point: Christ has appeared / manifested himself to people (such as Saul / Paul). Good angels of God can appear to people, i.e. - "Remember to welcome strangers, because some who have done this have welcomed angels without knowing it" (Hebrews 13:2-3). The key in knowing which is which is to have a well-studied knowledge of the Bible so you can discern whether they are Godly or demonic spirits. Very generally speaking, a good spirit will always act in accordance with God's ways, and a demonic spirit will act according to the ways / beliefs of the devil. A demonic spirit never does anything to help point people in the direction of Christ or testify about him, but they will try to confuse people into believing in or following false Christs (David Koresh, for example) and false prophets / mediums / and the sort. That's why the New Testament says to "test the spirits".
